Message.Title: Ethernet extra port option not installed
Message.Description: A EtherNet/IP I/O bus is configured to use the extra Ethernet port, but the Ethernet extra port option has not been installed.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the EtherNet/IP functionality, without installing the correct option.
Message.Actions:
1. If the Ethernet extra port option is required: configure a new system with this option, and install the system.
2. If the Ethernet extra port option is not required: change the configuration and restart the system.

Message.Title: Too many EtherNet/IP buses are configured
Message.Description: Too many EtherNet/IP I/O buses are configured. There is only possibly to have one I/O bus for EtherNet/IP Master/Slave.
Message.Actions:
1. Remove one the EtherNet/IP buses from the configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Wrong identity for EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description:
The identity for the I/O unit <> in the configuration is not correct.
The correct identity is:
Vendor ID <>
Device Type <>
Product Code <>
Message.Consequences: No contact will be established with this I/O unit.
Message.Actions: Correct the configuration for the I/O unit type with the identity information above.

Message.Title: The address is missing
Message.Description: No IP address is specified for the I/O bus.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the I/O bus is possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Specify a valid IP address in the I/O bus configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: EtherNet/IP connection type unknown
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The unit type <> has an invalid/unknown connection type <>.
The connection type must be one of the following:
- MULTICAST
- POINT2POINT
Message.Consequences: This unit type has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
1. Correct the connection type of the unit type.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: EtherNet/IP hardware is missing
Message.Description: The DSQC 612 hardware needed for running EtherNet/IP is missing.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Causes:
An attempt may have been made to add EtherNet/IP functionality on the first Ethernet port, without installing the correct hardware.
Note: If you are running MultiMove two DSQC 612 boards are required, otherwise one board.
Message.Actions:
1. Install a DSQC 612 board in the controller.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: The EtherNet/IP gateway address is invalid
Message.Description:
It is not possible to have the gateway address same as the IP address.
Or the gateway address can not be same as the default destination <0.0.0.0>.
Message.Consequences: The default controller gateway address <> will be used and not the specified gateway address <>.
Message.Actions:
1. If no physical gateway is used, do not specify any gateway address in the configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Could not change the default gateway address
Message.Description: If no destination address is specified in the Ethernet/IP configuration, the default controller gateway address will be changed. The destination address was not given and the specified gateway address <> was not valid and could not be used..
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Correct the gateway in the EtherNet/IP I/O bus configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Illegal address for EtherNet/IP
Message.Description: The address <> for the EtherNet/IP bus is illegal.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Correct the address in the EtherNet/IP bus configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Not able to connect to EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The configured I/O unit <> with address <> does not physically exist on the EtherNet/IP bus.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to access the I/O unit or I/O signals on it, since it is currently not communicating with the controller. The system will go to state SYS FAIL, if the I/O unit has been assigned Unit Trust level Required (0) in the configuration.
Message.Causes:
The I/O unit does not exist physically.
The I/O unit address is wrong.
The I/O unit is malfunctioning.
Message.Actions:
1. Check if the I/O unit physically exist on the EtherNet/IP bus or if the address is correct.
2. If the address has been changed, restart the system.

Message.Title: Duplicated address on the EtherNet/IP I/O bus
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> and the EtherNet/IP master have been configured with the same address in the controller.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to access the I/O unit or I/O signals on it, since it is currently not communicating with the controller.
Message.Actions:
1. Change the address for the I/O unit <> or the address for the EtherNet/IP master in the configuration. If changing the I/O unit address and it have this address physically it must also be changed in the I/O unit.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Illegal subnet mask for EtherNet/IP
Message.Description: The subnet mask <> for the EtherNet/IP bus is illegal.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Correct the subnet mask in the EtherNet/IP bus configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Illegal address for EtherNet/IP bus
Message.Description: The EtherNet/IP address <> is reserved.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Causes:
The specified address is on a subnet reserved by another Ethernet port. Two Ethernet ports on the controller can not be on the same subnet.
Example:
EtherNet/IP port: 192.168.125.x
Service port: 192.168.125.x
Note:
The subnets within the range 192.168.125.xxx - 192.168.130.xxx are predefined and can not be used.
Message.Actions:
1. Change the address to another subnet.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Could not add a new gateway for EtherNet/IP
Message.Description: Could not add the gateway address <> with the destination address <> for EtherNet/IP.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Causes:
1. The gateway address or the destination address are invalid.
2. No destination address have been specified.
Message.Actions:
1. Correct the gateway address or the destination address in the EtherNet/IP bus configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean error response
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> has reported an error response.
General Error Code .
Additional Code
Message.Actions:
1. Read about the General Error Code in the DeviceNet Lean application manual or the DeviceNet specification Appendix H .
2. The I/O unit might be occupied by another master.
3. Cycle the power of the I/O unit.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration failed
Message.Description:
The configuration file <> was not accepted by the DSQC 678.
Error code returned .
Message.Consequences: No new configuration will be stored in the DSQC 678.
Message.Actions: Make sure that the correct filetype is used.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration file missing
Message.Description: The configuration file <> was not found.
Message.Consequences: No new configuration will be stored in the DSQC 678.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the file exists.
2. Make sure that the configuration file is placed in the HOME directory of your current system.

Message.Title: Profinet board DSQC 678 upgraded
Message.Description: The Profinet board DSQC 678 have been upgraded to a new firmware with version <>
Message.Consequences: The new firmware might affect some of the configuration parameters or other communication behaviour.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure that no configuration changes are needed for connecting controllers.
2. Make sure that current Step 7 configuration in the DSQC 678 is compatible with the new firmware.

Message.Title: Max number of internal I/O signals exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of internal I/O signals in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of I/O signals specfied in the additional option configuration) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Wrong unit type
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> connected to the DeviceNet Lean bus is not of the same type as configured.
Reported vendor ID was , expected was .
Message.Consequences: No communication to the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Change the I/O unit configuration.

Message.Title: Duplicated address on DeviceNet Lean bus
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> and the DeviceNet Lean master is configured with the same address.
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit <> has been rejected.
Message.Actions: 1. Change address for I/O unit <> or the DeviceNet Lean master.

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean bus scan result
Message.Description: Address: Product: Vendor ID: Product code:

Message.Title: Fieldbus command response message
Message.Description:
An 'Get data response' message <> from I/O unit <> was received.
Response message as raw data:
Response message as string:

Message.Title: Fieldbus command error response
Message.Description:
The fieldbus command <> sent to I/O unit <> returned an error response.
Error code: <>
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not accepted by the I/O unit.
Message.Actions: Read about the General Error Code in the DeviceNet Lean application manual or the DeviceNet specification Appendix H.

Message.Title: DeviceNet firmware file not found
Message.Description:
The DeviceNet <> firmware file not found or not readable.
The board firmware may be out of date.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Invalid connection size for EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> is configured with a invalid input and/or output size.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Correct the size for the I/O unit in the unit type configuration.

Message.Title: Invalid input or output assembly for EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> have a invalid input and/or output assembly.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Correct the input/output assembly for the I/O unit in the unit type configuration.

Message.Title: Invalid configuration assembly for EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> have a invalid configuration assembly.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Correct the configuration assembly for the I/O unit in the unit type configuration.

Message.Title: I/O unit occupied by another master
Message.Description: It is not possible to connect to the I/O unit <> because it has already an active connection.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit <> is possible as long as the I/O unit is occupied by another master.
Message.Actions: Release the connection from the other master to the I/O unit <> or change the address.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration file error
Message.Description: The Profinet configuration file <> could not be found or opened.
Message.Consequences: The configuration file is needed to be able to use the I/O units defined on the <> I/O bus.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the file exists.
2. Make sure that the configuration file is placed in the HOME directory of your current system if filename without path is used.

Message.Title: Profinet bus configuration changed
Message.Description:
System parameters on I/O bus <> have been changed by an external configuration tool or a connecting master.
The following values have been changed:
IP Address: <>
Subnet mask: <>
Gateway address: <>
Message.Consequences: The changed parameter values are not valid until a warmstart of the controller is performed.
Message.Actions: Perform a warmstart.

Message.Title: Profinet identification request received
Message.Description:
A Profinet identification request has been received from an external configuration tool.
The MAC address on the <> I/O bus is <>.

Message.Title: Profinet hardware missing
Message.Description: The DSQC 612 board needed to run the <> I/O bus on the selected connector id is missing.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the <> I/O bus is possible.
Message.Actions: Install a DSQC 612 board in the controller or use the LAN connector id instead.

Message.Title: Illegal subnet mask
Message.Description: The subnet mask <> for the <> I/O bus is illegal. The allowed subnet mask range is <255.255.255.xxx>.
Message.Consequences: The subnet mask on the <> I/O bus was not changed.
Message.Actions: 1. Correct the subnet mask for the <> I/O bus.

Message.Title: Illegal address for <> I/O bus
Message.Description: The IP address <> for the <> I/O bus is illegal.
Message.Consequences: The <> I/O bus can not be used.
Message.Actions: Correct the address for the <> I/O bus.

Message.Title: Illegal IP address for <> I/O bus
Message.Description: The <> I/O bus address <> is reserved.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the <> I/O bus is possible.
Message.Causes:
The specified address is on a subnet reserved by another Ethernet port. Two Ethernet ports on the controller cannot be on the same subnet.
Example:
<> port: 192.168.125.xxx
Service port: 192.168.125.xxx
Note:
The subnets within the range 192.168.125.xxx - 192.168.130.xxx are predefined and cannot be used.
Message.Actions: Change the address to another subnet.

Message.Title: Illegal gateway address for <> I/O bus
Message.Description: The specified gateway address <> is not valid and can not be used.
Message.Consequences: The gateway address is not changed.
Message.Causes: The specified gateway address might not be within the range of the <> I/O bus subnet mask <>.
Message.Actions: Correct the gateway address in the <> I/O bus configuration.

Message.Title: Profinet internal slave configuration warning
Message.Description:
A Profinet master has established a connection with the Profinet internal slave on the <> I/O bus. The connecting Profinet master and the internal Profinet slave slot configuration differs.
The internal Profinet slave is currently configured with the following modules:
Slot 1: DI bytes
Slot 2: DO bytes
Message.Consequences: Not all I/O signals will be possible to use.
Message.Actions:
1. Reconfigure the connecting Profinet master to match the internal Profinet slave.
2. Reconfigure the internal Profinet slave in the Robot controller to match the connecting Profinet master.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit configuration warning
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> on the <> I/O bus is configured in the Profinet configuration file <> but not in the system parameters.
Message.Actions: Add the I/O unit <> to the system parameters or remove the I/O unit from the Profinet configuration file.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit configuration missing
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> on the <> I/O bus is configured in the system parameters but not in the Profinet configuration file <>.
Message.Consequences: No communication with I/O unit <> is possible.
Message.Actions: Add the I/O unit <> to the Profinet configuration file or remove the I/O unit from the system parameters.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit alarm
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> has reported an alarm in slot <>:

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit auto configured
Message.Description:
A new I/O unit has been found in the Profinet configuration file. This I/O unit has been auto configured in the controller with the following parameters:
Unit name:
Input bytes:
Output bytes:
Message.Actions:
1. Edit or delete the configuration.
2. Restart the controller to activate the I/O unit configuration.

Message.Title: Profinet option key missing
Message.Description: The option key needed to run the <> I/O bus on the controller was not detected.
Message.Consequences: No communication on <> I/O bus is possible.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the Profinet functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions:
1. Configure a new system with the Profinet SW option, and install that system.
2. If Profinet SW is not required, configure a new system without this option, and install that system.

Message.Title: Profinet master option key missing
Message.Description: The option key needed to run the <> I/O bus as a Profinet master on the controller was not detected. The I/O unit <> is not defined as an internal Profinet slave.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit <> is possible.
Message.Causes: The installed option key for the <> I/O bus only support one internal Profinet slave I/O unit.
Message.Actions: Configure a new system with the Profinet SW master/slave option or remove the I/O unit <> from the system parameters.

Message.Title: Lost communication with required unit
Message.Description: The previously working communication with I/O unit with address on I/O bus has been lost.
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit has been assigned Unit Trustlevel Required (0) in the configuration. The system will go to system failure state.
Message.Causes: The I/O unit may have been disconnected from the system.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure that the bus cable is connected to the controller.
2. Make sure the I/O unit has is correctly powered.
3. Make sure the cabling to the I/O unit is correctly connected.

Message.Title: No communication with I/O unit
Message.Description: During start-up, no communication was established with I/O unit with address on the I/O bus
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit has been assigned Unit Trustlevel Required (0) in the configuration. The system will go to system failure state.
Message.Causes: The I/O unit is either not connected to the system, or it is connected, but has been assigned the wrong address.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure all I/O unit addresses match the configuration.
2. Make sure all addresses are unique, and not used by more than one I/O unit.
3. Change the address and/or connect the missing I/O unit.
4. If you changed the address, the power supply to the I/O unit must be cycled (switched OFF and then back ON), to make sure the address has been changed.
5. Make sure that the field bus is working

Message.Title: Profinet bus configuration changed
Message.Description:
Bus type system parameters on I/O bus <> have been changed by an external configuration tool or a connecting master.
The following values have been changed:
Station name: <>
Message.Consequences: The changed parameter values are not valid until a warmstart of the controller is performed.
Message.Actions: Perform a warmstart.

Message.Title: I/O signals in cross connection has overlapping unit map
Message.Description: The resultant I/O signal <> has an overlapping unit map with the inverted actor I/O signal <>.
Message.Consequences: Using I/O signals with overlapping unit map in a cross connection can cause infinity signal setting loops.
Message.Actions: Correct the unit map or define one of the I/O signals as virtual.

Message.Title: EtherNet/IP connection failure
Message.Description: Not able to connect to the I/O unit <>.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration file error
Message.Description: The Profinet configuration file <> was not valid. Internal error code <>.
Message.Consequences: No communication on <> I/O bus is possible.
Message.Causes: The Profinet configuration file may be corrupted or have been created with a incompatible file format.
Message.Actions: Generate a new Profinet configuration file.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration mismatch
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> reported a different slot configuration compared with the configuration for this I/O unit in the Profinet configuration file <>.
First slot mismatch reported on slot <>
<> slot mismatches found.
Message.Consequences: Some I/O signals might not be possible to use.
Message.Causes: The module type used in slot <> may be of wrong type or of a different version compared to the actual hardware on the I/O unit.
Message.Actions:
1. Update the Profinet configuration file <>
2. Check the I/O unit hardware.

Message.Title: Profinet station name error
Message.Description: The I/O bus system parameter <Station Name> on the <> I/O bus contains one or more illegal characters. The character at position <> is not allowed.
Message.Consequences: The <> I/O bus is not possible to use.
Message.Actions: Change the <Station Name> system parameter to an allowed string.

Message.Title: File size exceeds max file size
Message.Description:
Unable to copy file data to the controller. The file is too large.
File size:
Max file size:
Message.Causes: The file size is larger than the allowed file size.
Message.Actions: Check the FTP client configuration and increase the system parameter MaxFileSize to be able to transfer the file to the controller.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command syntax error
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because there is a syntax error in the command path string.
Fieldbus command type name <>.
The syntax error: Missing comma.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command path string.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command syntax error
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because there is a syntax error in the command path string.
Fieldbus command type name <>.
The syntax error: Bad path size specified.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command path string.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command syntax error
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because there is a syntax error in the command path string.
Fieldbus command type name <>.
The syntax error: Incorrect path size.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command path string.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command syntax error
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because there is a syntax error in the command path string.
Fieldbus command type name <>.
The syntax error: Bad data type.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command path string.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command syntax error
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because there is a syntax error in the command path string.
Fieldbus command type name <>.
The syntax error: Missing space.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command path string.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command syntax error
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because there is a syntax error in the command path string.
Fieldbus command type name <>.
The syntax error: Incorrect byte size.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command path string.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command syntax error
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because there is a syntax error in the command path string.
Fieldbus command type name <>.
The syntax error: Incorrect data size.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command path string.

Message.Title: Invalid service identifier in fieldbus command
Message.Description:
Could not send fieldbus command to I/O unit <> because of invalid service identifier <>.
Valid service identifiers are:
<>
Message.Actions: Correct the service identifier.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command response timeout
Message.Description: A timeout occurred when sending fieldbus command <> to the I/O unit <>
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the fieldbus command syntax.
2. Make sure that the bus cable is connected to the controller.
2. Make sure the I/O unit has is correctly powered.
3. Make sure the cabling to the I/O unit is correctly connected.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command connection error
Message.Description: Could not send fieldbus command <> to the I/O unit <> because no active connection was present.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the fieldbus command syntax.
2. Make sure that the bus cable is connected to the controller.
2. Make sure the I/O unit has is correctly powered.
3. Make sure the cabling to the I/O unit is correctly connected.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command send error
Message.Description: Could not send fieldbus command <> to the I/O unit <>.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus command was not sent.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the fieldbus command syntax.
2. Make sure that the bus cable is connected to the controller.
2. Make sure the I/O unit has is correctly powered.
3. Make sure the cabling to the I/O unit is correctly connected.

Message.Title: An EtherNet/IP I/O unit does not support Quick Connect
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> does not support Quick Connect.
Message.Actions:
1. Set the unit type parameter Quick Connect to "Not used" for the I/O unit in the I/O configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: An attribute is changed for an EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The attribute is changed to "" for the I/O unit <>.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration mismatch
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> reported a different slot configuration compared with the configuration loaded for this I/O unit.
First slot mismatch reported on slot <>
<> slot mismatches found.
Message.Consequences: Some I/O signals might not be possible to use.
Message.Causes: The module type used in slot <> may be of wrong type or of a different version compared to the actual hardware on the I/O unit.
Message.Actions:
1. Update the Profinet configuration
2. Check the I/O unit hardware.

Message.Title: Too many Profinet Master/Slave SW buses are configured
Message.Description: Too many Profinet Master/Slave SW I/O buses are configured. It is only possible to have one I/O bus for Profinet Master/Slave SW.
Message.Actions:
1. Remove all but one of the Profinet Master/Slave SW buses from the configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Input data invalid
Message.Description: The unit <> indicates input data invalid from slot<>.
Message.Consequences: The input data is discarded.

Message.Title: Output data not processed
Message.Description: The unit <> indicates output data to slot <> cannot be processed.
Message.Consequences: The output data is discarded by the unit.

Message.Title: Ethernet port occupied by another client
Message.Description: The specified Ethernet port for EtherNet/IP bus is occupied by another client.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP bus is possible.
Message.Causes: A MultiMove system is installed and occupies the specified Ethernet port.
Message.Actions: Select another Ethernet port by changing the connector ID for the EtherNet/IP bus.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit unknown alarm
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> has reported an unknown alarm in slot <>
Use I/O unit specific documentation for explanation on the alarm code.
Alarm code:

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit diagnostics
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> has reported diagnostic data in slot <>.
Use I/O unit specific documentation for more explanation on the diagnostic data.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit unknown alarm
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> has reported an unknown alarm in slot <>
Use I/O unit specific documentation for explanation on the alarm code.
Alarm code:

Message.Title: EtherNet/IP device state conflict
Message.Description: The current state of the I/O unit <> prevents communication from being established or the execution of a specific service. This is a device specific behavior documented by the vendor.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit <> is possible as long as the I/O unit is in this state.
Message.Actions:
1. Verify the current state of the I/O unit <>.
2. If the state is error, check the I/O configuration or hardware setup of the I/O unit and consult the vendor documentation. If the state is running, the I/O unit was earlier temporarily busy during communication attempt but has now recovered, no further actions are necessary.

Message.Title: EtherNet/IP general failure
Message.Description: Not able to connect to the I/O unit <>.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.

Message.Title: Invalid configuration size for EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> has an invalid configuration size. Maximum configuration size supported are <> bytes.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Correct the configuration size for the I/O unit in the unit type configuration.

Message.Title: Invalid output size for EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> has an invalid output size. Maximum output size supported are <> bytes.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Correct the output size for the I/O unit in the unit type configuration.

Message.Title: Invalid input size for EtherNet/IP I/O unit
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> has an invalid input size. Maximum input size supported are <> bytes.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Correct the input size for the I/O unit in the unit type configuration.
